snippet: President Mohamed Morsi  of Egypt, responding for the first time to criticism of newly surfaced videos, said through a spokesman that his ire was directed at “the Israeli aggression in Gaza,” not at Jews.
abstract: Spokesman for Egypt's Pres Mohamed Morsi says that inflammatory comments he made about Jews before taking office had been intended as criticism of Israeli policies toward Palestinians, but had been taken out of context; say Morsi respects all monotheistic religions and religious freedom.
lead_paragraph: President Mohamed Morsi  of Egypt, responding for the first time to criticism of newly surfaced videos, said through a spokesman that his ire was directed at “the Israeli aggression in Gaza,” not at Jews.

headline.seo: Egypt’s Morsi Says Slurs of Jews Were Taken Out of Context
headline.main: Morsi Says His Slurs of Jews Were Taken Out of Context
headline.print_headline: Morsi Says His Slurs of Jews Were Taken Out of Context
